poem:
Title: 'Speech Weaving Shadows'

Hate, a harsh hiss,
cracked from the mouth of
a gilded benefactor,
Invoking clouds
over Diane, unflinching.

Tell me, does
the moon spurn the sun
for casting shadows?

Black and full,
Diane is rich night,
a multitude of pinprick stars,
an universe undimmed.
 
Words cannot shroud her glow,
nor darken all her sisters. 
They, too, shine.
